dict.string: Scrolling down you'll connect the dots that brought me up here.
I left the job that was my dream job in the past. I was looking for new experiences, looking for a job where I could really make the difference.

After quitting my job, I heard about BEPiD(Brazilian Education Program for iOS Development), an educational program to train iOS developers. It was very exciting to me, and despite knowing little about the platform I decided to sign up. I was accepted and early on I realized that would not be the same at the end of this program.

After six months participating in BEPiD I released my first app, which I called LimPOA. The LimPOA is a guide that helps residents of the city of Porto Alegre to properly dispose of their waste and it uses open data provided by the Government.

I was very excited with the announcement of Swift language, so I decided to build an app to explore this new amazing language, I did it and I’ve made it open-source at GitHub to share with the people the way that I used Swift to built my app. I’ve shared it with the intent to help someone to learn and receive suggestions of improvements.
Thanks to the code of my first Swift app that I've opened, I got an "full-Swift" job! It's being amazing work just with Swift and I'm learning a lot about it.

Wow! Thank you for connect this dot and give to me a ticket to WWDC 15! Haha just a joke, but I really want this to became reality. Certainly go to WWDC will bring me a lot of amazing dots that I'll connect in my future.
